results.definition: installation from which a military force initiates operations
examples: the attack wiped out our forward bases

results.definition: lowest support of a structure
examples: it was built on a base of solid rock
he stood at the foot of the tower

results.definition: a place that the runner must touch before scoring
examples: he scrambled to get back to the bag

results.definition: the bottom or lowest part
examples: the base of the mountain

results.definition: (anatomy) the part of an organ nearest its point of attachment
examples: the base of the skull

results.definition: a lower limit
examples: the government established a wage floor

results.definition: the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained
examples: the whole argument rested on a basis of conjecture

results.definition: a support or foundation
examples: the base of the lamp

results.definition: a phosphoric ester of a nucleoside; the basic structural unit of nucleic acids (DNA or RNA)
any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water
examples: bases include oxides and hydroxides of metals and ammonia

results.definition: the bottom side of a geometric figure from which the altitude can be constructed
examples: the base of the triangle

results.definition: the most important or necessary part of something
examples: the basis of this drink is orange juice

results.definition: (numeration system) the positive integer that is equivalent to one in the next higher counting place
examples: 10 is the radix of the decimal system

results.definition: the place where you are stationed and from which missions start and end

a terrorist network intensely opposed to the United States that dispenses money and logistical support and training to a wide variety of radical Islamic terrorist groups; has cells in more than 50 countries
(linguistics) the form of a word after all affixes are removed
examples: thematic vowels are part of the stem

results.definition: the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
examples: the industrial base of Japan

results.definition: the principal ingredient of a mixture
examples: glycerinated gelatin is used as a base for many ointments
he told the painter that he wanted a yellow base with just a hint of green
everything she cooked seemed to have rice as the base

results.definition: a flat bottom on which something is intended to sit
examples: a tub should sit on its own base

results.definition: (electronics) the part of a transistor that separates the emitter from the collector
a relation that provides the foundation for something
examples: they were on a friendly footing
he worked on an interim basis

results.definition: the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained
examples: the whole argument rested on a basis of conjecture

results.definition: the most important or necessary part of something
examples: the basis of this drink is orange juice

results.definition: use as a basis for; found on
examples: base a claim on some observation

results.definition: situate as a center of operations
examples: we will base this project in the new lab

results.definition: use (purified cocaine) by burning it and inhaling the fumes
